annotation.message: An operand identifier [reference] is hiding another identifier of the same name.
An operand identifier [reference] is hiding another identifier of the same name.
An operand identifier [reference] is hiding another identifier of the same name.

a:t.name: Description
a:t.value:
Determine retest recommendation
Data Concepts: HIV.B.DE115: HIV status | HIV status reported after applying the national HIV testing algorithm. No single HIV test can provide an HIV-positive diagnosis. HIV.B.DE33: Partner HIV status (reported) | The HIV status of the client's partner. HIV.C.DE55: Sex partner's HIV treatment status | Treatment adherence of client's sex partner for partners that are HIV-positive HIV.Config.DE12: HIV burden of the setting | HIV burden of the setting (high or low) based on the national HIV prevalence or where the HIV prevalence and/or incidence in a geographical setting is higher than national prevalence and, therefore, needs priority in the HIV response HIV.B.DE49: Key population member | Client is a member of a key population that has an increased risk of HIV HIV.B.DE29: Currently pregnant | Client is currently pregnant HIV.D.DE939: TB diagnosis result | Final result of the TB investigation (bacteriological and/or clinical) HIV.D.DE282: Presumptive TB | Client's comorbidities or coinfections or symptoms of these include presumptive TB HIV.C.DE10: Currently on PrEP | The client is currently taking PrEP. Oral pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) of HIV is the use of ARV drugs by people who are not infected with HIV to block the acquisition of HIV. HIV.B.DE225: At elevated risk for HIV acquisition | Client is at elevated risk for HIV acquisition

def.name: Sex partner's HIV treatment status is partner not virally suppressed

a:t.name: input
a:t.value: "Sex partner's HIV treatment status is partner not virally suppressed"

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Sex partner's HIV treatment status"='Partner is not virally suppressed'

def.name: HIV burden of setting is high HIV burden setting

a:t.name: input
a:t.value: "HIV burden of setting is high HIV burden setting"

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "HIV burden of the setting"='High HIV burden setting'

def.name: HIV burden of setting is low HIV burden setting

a:t.name: input
a:t.value: "HIV burden of setting is low HIV burden setting"

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "HIV burden of the setting"='Low HIV burden setting'

def.name: TB diagnosis result is diagnosed TB
At elevated risk for HIV acquisition

"HIV burden of setting is high HIV burden setting"

def.name: Schedule quarterly retesting for PrEP users
Pregnant in high HIV burden setting

a:s.a:s: // Helper Logic define "Pregnant in high HIV burden setting":
"HIV burden of setting is high HIV burden setting"

a:t.value: "Schedule an HIV test, syphilis test, hepatitis B test as early as possible during this pregnancy"

a:t.value: "Schedule a 'Follow-up test recommended date during a third trimester visit"

def.name: Schedule a 'Follow-up test recommended date' at first ANC contact date

a:t.value: "Schedule a 'Follow-up test recommended date during a third trimester visit"

a:s.a:s: "Partner has HIV and is not virally suppressed"

operand.name: Pregnant in low HIV burden setting

when.name: Partner has HIV and is not virally suppressed
At elevated risk for HIV acquisition

a:s.a:s:
'Schedule an annual follow-up test.
WHO guidance recommends annual retesting for people who have ongoing HIV-related risks in all settings. These include people with a known HIV-positive partner who is not virally suppressed on ART.'

'Recommend a follow-up test.
In certain conditions and situations, individuals who have been tested for HIV in the past can be advised to retest. These include: * Individuals presenting with a diagnosis or receiving treatment for STIs or viral hepatitis, * Individuals with a confirmed or presumptive TB diagnosis, * Outpatients presenting with clinical conditions or symptoms indicative of HIV, individuals with recent HIV risk exposure.'
"Schedule an HIV test, syphilis test, hepatitis B test as early as possible during this pregnancy"

'Schedule an HIV test, syphilis test, hepatitis B test as early as possible during this pregnancy
All pregnant women should be tested for HIV as well as syphilis and hepatitis B virus at least once and as early as possible during pregnancy.'
"Schedule a 'Follow-up test recommended date' at first ANC contact date"

'In low HIV burden settings, retesting all pregnant women is not warranted unless focused among women from key populations or at high ongoing risk, such as those from key populations or with partners with HIV who are not virally suppressed. Countries could consider one additional retest in the post-partum period, such as at 14 weeks, six months or nine months for women in high HIV burden or incidence districts or provinces, key populations or women with partners with HIV who are not virally suppressed.'

then.value:
Schedule an annual follow-up test.
WHO guidance recommends annual retesting for people who have ongoing HIV-related risks in all settings. These include people with a known HIV-positive partner who is not virally suppressed on ART.

Recommend a follow-up test.
In certain conditions and situations, individuals who have been tested for HIV in the past can be advised to retest. These include: * Individuals presenting with a diagnosis or receiving treatment for STIs or viral hepatitis, * Individuals with a confirmed or presumptive TB diagnosis, * Outpatients presenting with clinical conditions or symptoms indicative of HIV, individuals with recent HIV risk exposure.

condition.name: Schedule quarterly retesting for PrEP users

then.value: Schedule quarterly retesting for PrEP users.

condition.name: Schedule an HIV test, syphilis test, hepatitis B test as early as possible during this pregnancy

then.value:
Schedule an HIV test, syphilis test, hepatitis B test as early as possible during this pregnancy
All pregnant women should be tested for HIV as well as syphilis and hepatitis B virus at least once and as early as possible during pregnancy.

condition.name: Schedule a 'Follow-up test recommended date' at first ANC contact date

then.value: In low HIV burden settings, retesting all pregnant women is not warranted unless focused among women from key populations or at high ongoing risk, such as those from key populations or with partners with HIV who are not virally suppressed. Countries could consider one additional retest in the post-partum period, such as at 14 weeks, six months or nine months for women in high HIV burden or incidence districts or provinces, key populations or women with partners with HIV who are not virally suppressed.

when.name: Schedule quarterly retesting for PrEP users
